metadata.title: USN-4217-1 -- Samba vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Andreas Oster discovered that the Samba DNS management server incorrectly handled certain records. An authenticated attacker could possibly use this issue to crash Samba, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2019-14861)  Isaac Boukris discovered that Samba did not enforce the Kerberos DelegationNotAllowed feature restriction, contrary to expectations. (CVE-2019-14870)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-4217-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libnss-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.24 libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.24 samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.24 registry-tools - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.24 libpam-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.24 libsmbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.24 smbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.24 python-samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.24 winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.24 samba-testsuite - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.24 samba-common-bin - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.24 libwbclient0 - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.24 libwbclient-dev - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.24 samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.24 samba-dev - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.24 libsmbclient-dev - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.24 samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.24 samba-common - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.24 samba-libs - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.24 ctdb - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.24 No subscription required
